title: Advanced Wellness Plus Healthcare Plan
summary: The slide introduces 'Advanced Wellness Plus,' a healthcare plan associated with American Financial Security Life Insurance Co. It features an image of a healthcare professional engaging with a senior patient, suggesting a focus on patient care and wellness. The text at the bottom provides legal information about the insurance plans, specifying that they are limited benefit health insurance plans underwritten by American Financial Security Life Insurance Co., with specific policy forms issued to the National Congress of Employers.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus Benefits Overview
summary: This slide outlines the benefits provided under the 'Advanced Wellness Plus' plan across various coverage levels, ranging from 100A to 1000. It includes a comprehensive table detailing the per day and maximum day benefits for different categories such as Hospital Confinement, Primary and Specialty Care Doctors Office Visits, Emergency Room, and various surgical and mental health benefits. Specific benefits like Basic Pathology & Radiology, Advance Studies, Surgery, Anesthesia, and Mental Health are included, with varying levels of coverage. Additionally, it covers Supplemental Accident Admission, Emergency Room Benefits, Hospital Intensive Care, Additional Hospital Admission, and Critical Illness benefits. The slide highlights that there is no coverage for pre-existing conditions for 12 months from the effective date and notes a 30-day waiting period post coverage effective date, excluding injuries.

title: Overview of Advanced Wellness Plus and NCE Membership
summary: The slide describes the National Congress of Employers (NCE), which supports small and medium-sized businesses in the U.S. by offering networking, advocacy, and information sharing. Members receive reliable services and benefits, with superior customer service. Upon successful application and payment, members get a Purchase Confirmation email with a membership handbook and insurance certificate. Monthly membership involves a billing statement for health benefits reflecting the monthly premium and a non-refundable enrollment fee. Limited Medical Coverage is explained as a plan providing basic insurance coverage, not a replacement for major medical plans, suitable for supplementing higher deductible major medical plans. Eligibility is for adult members aged 18-65 and dependent children aged 1-25.

title: Advanced Wellness Plus: GapAfford Plus - NCE Membership Benefits
summary: The slide outlines the benefits of the GapAfford Plus program, designed to reduce out-of-pocket medical expenses for individuals and families. Key features include no deductibles, claim forms, or age restrictions, with savings on prescription drugs, pet medications, dental services, and more. The program partners with the OUTLOOK Vision Network, offering discounts on eyeglasses, lenses, and medical eye exams. Other benefits include savings on alternative medicine, chiropractic care, hearing aids, medical supplies, and equipment. The program also offers a 24/7 health information line and nurse help line, though it is not insurance. Additional services include savings on lab tests, physical therapy, and vitamins.

title: Hospital Indemnity Insurance Limitations & Exclusions
summary: The slide outlines various limitations and exclusions of a hospital indemnity insurance policy, specifying conditions under which benefits will not be provided. Benefits will not cover non-medically necessary treatments, experimental procedures, or services rendered by family members. Additional exclusions include dental procedures except for accidental injury treatment, elective and cosmetic surgeries, felonies, musculoskeletal system manipulations, self-inflicted injuries, acts of war, work-related injuries, and pre-existing conditions without coverage for 12 months. Special conditions include a 30-day waiting period for sickness benefits and no coverage for voluntary abortion unless life-threatening. Coverage provisions emphasize the need to refer to the Certificate of Insurance for complete details. Claims are to be mailed or submitted electronically to International Benefits Administrators.
